meanings.definition: To write or print in the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: She romanises her notes to make them easier to read.
meanings.sent2: The teacher romanises the text for the students to understand better.
meanings.sent3: The computer romanises the document automatically, saving time.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting romanises the page, making it look more formal.
meanings.sent5: The calligrapher romanises the text beautifully, adding elegance.

meanings.definition: To make Roman in character or style.
meanings.sent1: The architect romanises the building with columns and arches.
meanings.sent2: She romanises her outfit with a toga-inspired dress.
meanings.sent3: The chef romanises the dish by adding ancient Roman spices.
meanings.sent4: His speech romanises the event, giving it a grand feel.
meanings.sent5: The artist romanises the painting, capturing the essence of Rome.
